description:
Hyperion is a high resolution hyperspectral imager producing 220 unique
spectral channels ranging from 0.357 to 2.576 micrometers with a 10-nm
bandwidth. The instrument operates in a pushbroom fashion, with a spatial
resolution of 30 meters for all bands and a standard scene width of 7.7
kilometers.

This dataset contains level 1A radiance images, radiometrically calibrated
and orthorectified. The SWIR bands have a scaling factor of 80 and the VNIR
bands have a scaling factor of 40 applied.

- VNIR bands (B008-B057, 426.82nm - 925.41nm): L = Digital Number / 40

- SWIR bands (B077-B224, 912.45nm - 2395.50nm): L = Digital Number / 80

Note that bands B001-B007, B058-B076, and B225-242 are not calibrated,
have no valid values and are not included into EE assets. See the
[detailed spectral coverage information](https://doi.org/10.5066/P9JXHMO2).

This is a preview dataset; only a portion of the data from the
original source have been downloaded.

links.title: Run the example for EO1/HYPERION in the Earth Engine Code Editor

gee:terms_of_use:
Hyperion data are in the public domain. Once a scene has been
downloaded from the USGS, it can be redistributed as desired.
sci:citation: Data available from the U.S. Geological Survey.
title: EO-1 Hyperion Hyperspectral Imager

gee:schema.description: Indicator of whether image was corrected for abnormal pixels: 'Y' or 'N'
gee:schema.name: ABNORMAL_PIXELS

gee:schema.description:
Correction method used by L1G in creating image: 'CPF' (for CPF bias) or
'NONE' (for no bias used)
gee:schema.name: CORRECTION_METHOD_BIAS

gee:schema.description:
Correction method used by L1G in creating the image: 'CPF' (for CPF bias)
or 'NONE' (for no bias used)
gee:schema.name: CORRECTION_METHOD_GAIN

gee:schema.description: Archive-generated external element file name for Calibration Parameter File
gee:schema.name: CPF_FILE_NAME

gee:schema.description: Date and hour of contact period start
gee:schema.name: DATEHOUR_CONTACT_PERIOD

gee:schema.description: DPS processing version number
gee:schema.name: DPS_VERSION_NUMBER

gee:schema.description:
Indicates the primary source (if any) of Digital Elevation Model (DEM)
used in the correction process: 'N' (no correction applied), 'SRTM-2',
'SRTM-1', 'NED', 'DTED', or 'GTOPO30'
gee:schema.name: ELEVATION_SOURCE

gee:schema.description: EO-1 X-band used to downlink data to LGS
gee:schema.name: EO1_XBAND

gee:schema.description:
Identifier to inform user of orbital ephemeris type used: 'ACS',
'DEFINITIVE', 'GPS', or 'PREDICTIVE'
gee:schema.name: EPHEMERIS_TYPE

gee:schema.description: Ground station that received data
gee:schema.name: GROUND_STATION

gee:schema.description:
Indicator of whether image was corrected for inoperable or out of spec
detectors: 'Y' or 'N'
gee:schema.name: INOPERABLE_DETECTORS

gee:schema.description: L1G processing system and software version
gee:schema.name: PROCESSING_SOFTWARE

gee:schema.description: L1G system date and time when metadata file for L1G product set was created.
gee:schema.name: PRODUCT_CREATION_TIME

gee:schema.description: Identifier to inform user of product type: 'L1GS' or 'L1GST'
gee:schema.name: PRODUCT_TYPE

gee:schema.description: Resampling option used in creating image: 'NN' or 'CC'
gee:schema.name: RESAMPLING_OPTION

gee:schema.description: Scaling factor used to convert calibrated DN to radiance units for bands 77-224
gee:schema.name: SCALING_FACTOR_SWIR

gee:schema.description: Scaling factor used to convert calibrated DN to radiance units for bands 8-57
gee:schema.name: SCALING_FACTOR_VNIR

gee:schema.description:
The look angle is the angle between nadir and the center of the
collected image. It is zero when the collected data are centered at the
nadir point. The angle when descending is positive when the sensor is
pointing east, negative when the sensor is pointing west of nadir.
-90 - 90
gee:schema.name: SENSOR_LOOK_ANGLE

gee:schema.description: Indicator of whether image was corrected for striping: 'Y' or 'N'
gee:schema.name: STRIPING

gee:schema.description:
Sun azimuth angle in degrees for image center location at image
center acquisition time. -180 through 180 where a
positive value indicates angles to the east or clockwise from north and a
negative value indicates angles to the west or counterclockwise from
north.
gee:schema.name: SUN_AZIMUTH

gee:schema.description:
Sun elevation angle in degrees for image center location at
image center acquisition time. -90 through 90 where a
positive value indicates a daytime scene and a negative value indicates a
nighttime scene.
gee:schema.name: SUN_ELEVATION
